holidays.name: National LED Bulb Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the energy-efficient and long-lasting LED light bulbs that illuminate our homes and reduce electricity bills.
holidays.origin: Established by lighting industry advocates to promote energy conservation and environmental awareness.
holidays.funFact: LED bulbs can last up to 25,000 hours, which is about 25 times longer than traditional incandescent bulbs!

holidays.name: International Frugal Fun Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration encouraging people to have fun without spending a dime. Think free concerts, DIY crafts, and creative adventures!
holidays.origin: Started by thrifty communities to inspire joyful, low-cost living and environmental consciousness.
holidays.funFact: The first recorded Frugal Fun Day had zero budget but attracted over 1,000 participants who brought their own games and snacks.

holidays.name: World Smile Day (First Friday of October)
holidays.description: Though not always on October 7, sometimes this day coincides with the first Friday of October‚Äîa day to honor the power of a smile and spreading kindness.
holidays.origin: Created by Harvey Ball, the inventor of the smiley face, to promote goodwill and cheer worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Millions of people participate worldwide by performing random acts of kindness and flashing big smiles to strangers.

holidays.name: Bathtub Party Day
holidays.description: A lighthearted, unofficial holiday dedicated to enjoying a relaxing soak in the tub ‚Äî with bubbles, rubber ducks, and maybe even a good book or tunes.
holidays.origin: Origin is unknown but embraced by self-care enthusiasts who value a quirky way to destress.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that taking a warm bath can reduce stress hormones and improve sleep quality‚Äîbathtub parties are scientifically awesome!
